message:

[SIZE=4][FONT=Segoe UI]The system came in dead found a partial short on PPBUS_G3H_SPKRAMP diode mode reading is 0.0073 and U6500 is getting hot on thermal camera.
Short gone but still draws 5.17v 0.0A,PPBUS_G3H is now 1V
R7020 has 5V
PP3V3_G3H_RTC is 0V..
What should I do next 🤔[/FONT][/SIZE]

title: 820-00850 5.17V 0.00A no power
message:
"PP3V3_G3H_RTC is 0V"
Must get PPBUS_G3H first; try to understand the schematic.

Diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H?
Checked if F7000 isn't burnt?

title: 820-00850 5.17V 0.00A no power
message:
Diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H is 0.433
F7000 is okay

title: 820-00850 5.17V 0.00A no power
message:
PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR -5v
PP1v8_SLPS2R- 0.265 v
CHGR_CSO_p- 1.2v
CHGR_CSO_N -0.002v
CHGR_AUX_DET-1.2v
Resistance on all point ok

title: 820-00850 5.17V 0.00A no power
message:
"CHGR_CSO_p- 1.2v
CHGR_CSO_N -0.002v"
Check R7060/61 and their traces.

title: 820-00850 5.17V 0.00A no power
message:
Chgr_cso_R_P and chgr_cso_R_N
There's no open circuit between them and PPBUS_G3H is 1V 
CSIN 5V
CSIP 0V
PBUS_PWR 5v
Aux DET 1.25

title: 820-00850 5.17V 0.00A no power
message:
CSOP/N [U][B]must[/B][/U] have equal voltage; same valid for CSIP/N.
Do you really get 2 ohm over C7020/23?
